meanings.sent1: She redistills the water to make it pure.
meanings.sent2: The scientist redistills the liquid to extract the desired compound.
meanings.sent3: After accidentally mixing the chemicals, she redistills them to separate them again.
meanings.sent4: His passion for chemistry redistills with each experiment, making him more knowledgeable.
meanings.sent5: The moonshine maker redistills the alcohol to improve its quality.

meanings.definition: To undergo the process of distillation again.
meanings.sent1: The mixture redistills in the distillation apparatus.
meanings.sent2: The solution redistills to separate the components effectively.
meanings.sent3: The perfume bottle accidentally knocked over and redistills on the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her memories redistill in her mind, becoming clearer with each recollection.
meanings.sent5: The essence of the flower redistills in the distillation process, creating a potent fragrance.
